column4: If the boot order on a computer is to boot hard drive D and then C would changing the OS on hard drive D from winXP to Ubuntu Linux cause problems?
A guy I'm talking to on MSN disagrees
what Pelo said is correct. You shouldn't have any "problems"

Try it first. The only way you can discover which one is best is to try different ones. Others might support your hardware better than ubuntu does. Also, some other distributions ship with proprietary software/codecs by default which you might like.
